explosives.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though the substance contains unsaturated C-C bonds as chemical groups associated with explosive properties present.

flammable_liquids.rationale: Not classified because of its flash point: 97degC (ACGIH, 2001, used value; HSDB peer review value)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: The ignition points It was carried out the outside of Category based on the ignition points is 210 degC (> 70 degC).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) chemically bonded only to carbon (but not to other elements).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: It was set as Category 4 based on average LD50= 443.7 mg/kg. This average was calculated using the upper/lower limits of rat oral LD50 values = 250-500, 590, and 1300 mg/kg (Patty (5th, 2001) , and 950-1130 mg/kg (DFGOT (2001)). In addition, although compound is considered to be a mixture of isomers, ACGIH and DFG were estimated for isomer. From the description that "All toxicity studies are conducted by all hydroxypropylacrylate isomers, mainly 75% 2-hydroxy-1-propyl acrylate and 25% 1-hydroxy-2-propyl acrylate or 66% 2-hydroxy-1-propyl acrylate, 33% 1-hydroxy-2-propyl acrylate and 1% free acrylic acid" (DFGOT (2001)), it was assumed that each component indicated equal toxicity.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was set as Category 2 based on rabbits dermal LD50= 112 ul/kg (DFGOT (2001)) = 112 x specific gravity 1.06 = 119mg/kg. In addition, although test compound is considered to be a mixture of isomers, both ACGIH and DFG were evalated as a mixture. And the description that "toxicity studies have been performed by all hydroxypropylacrylate isomers, mainly 75% 2-hydroxy-1-propyl acrylate and 25% 1-hydroxy-2-propyl acrylate or 66% 2-hydroxy-1-propyl acrylate, 33% 1-hydroxy-2-propyl acrylate, and 1% free acrylic acid" (DFGOT (2001)), it was assumed that each component indicates equal toxicity.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was classified as skin corrosiveness Category 1A-1C based the statement of "the critical depths necrosis" (DFGOT (2001)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: It was considered as the eye lesional Category 1 by the statement of "an instant critical eye stimulus and cornea damage" (ACGIH (2001)).

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Category1
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: (Respiratory sensitization)-; (Skin sensitization)May cause allergic skin reaction
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: EU-Annex1: It was referred to the skin sensitization Category 1 based on R43 and the statement that it causes sensitization to humans (DFGOT (2001)). Respiratory sensitization: No data

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the statements, "pulmonary edemas is caused, if its vapor is inhaled" (ICSC (1998)), and "Irritation in the upper airway and respiratory was observed by the single time inhalation test with rats" (ACGIH (2001), DFGOT (2001)), it was set as Category 2(respiratory systems).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (respiratory organs) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Inflammation in the respiratory systems and localized pneumonia are seen by inhalation dosage of 0.053 mg/L for 30-day using a mouse, a dog, a rat and a rabbit. (DFGOT (2001)) Since the dose with effect was below the guidance value (0.2 mg/L) of Category 1, it was classified to Category 1.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 96-hour LC50=3100microg/L of fishes (Fathead minnows) (AQUIRE, 2003).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since rapidly degrading (BOD: 61.3% (existing chemical safety inspections data)), and less bio-accumulative (log Kow=0.35 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).
